# graphics_examples
Example home work projects typically executed over about a week's worth of time. 

For all examples, except for HW6, to review the examples clone the full repository, then double click the .html file to launch it in your browser to see the graphics. HW6 simply has a link. I also made gifs to represent the works so you can visualize them here without cloning.

- [HW 8 - DND Die with texture, exploring reflectance and texture application](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW8CompGraphics)
![](figures/die_w_texture.gif)
- [HW 7 - DND Die with skin, lighting, rotation. Building my own 'primitive shape.'](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW7CompGraphics)
![](figures/die_w_only1texture.gif)
- [HW 6 - Playing with shaders - GLSL.](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW6CompGraphics) 

    - If you don't have time to clone anything to look at examples you can at least look at [this example I updated shaders for on the web](https://shdr.bkcore.com/#), please change the primitive to the dragon. It should look like this and have some fun wiggling action:
    ![](figures/dragon.gif)

- [HW 5 - 1st 3D visualization. Building an understanding of piecewise parametric curves and occlusion with drawing order when using projections](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW5CompGraphics)
![](figures/parmCurvLoop.gif)
- [HW 4 - Exploring piecewise parametric cuves. If you clone you can toggle the curve paths on and off](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW5CompGraphics)
![](figures/paramCurvs.gif)
- [HW 3 - Learning about parametric curves ](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW3CompGraphics)
![](figures/2dBees.gif)
- [HW 2 - Practicing some object oriented programming and recursion in JavaScript. This one is sort of mesmarizing to watch at normal speed in the browser, so I do recomend cloning this to view over the gif.](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW2CompGraphics)
![](figures/trees.gif)
- [HW 1 - First exposure to drawing any 2D canvas drawing on the screen.](https://github.com/roettges/graphics_examples/tree/main/LauraRoettges_HW1CompGraphics)
![](figures/train.gif)
